case_vignette: a 33-year-old black man presents to a dermatology clinic with a 5-month history of asymptomatic lesions on his arms and trunk. he is otherwise healthy with no personal or family history of skin disease. he has no history of fever, cough, shortness of breath, or joint pain. the patient has not tried any treatments for these lesions. on examination, there are several smooth, well-demarcated hypopigmented plaques on his upper arms and left flank. he has no similar lesions elsewhere on his body.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have painless light-colored patches on my upper arms and left side of my trunk.
How long have you noticed these patches?
I've noticed these patches for about 5 months.
Have these patches changed in size or shape since you first noticed them?
No, the patches have not changed in size or shape since I first noticed them.
Do these patches feel itchy or cause any other sensation?
No, the patches are asymptomatic; they don't itch or cause any sensation.
Do you have any previous history of similar skin issues, or any chronic illnesses?
No, I don't have any personal or family history of skin disease, and I am otherwise healthy with no chronic illnesses.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you used any new skin products recently?
No, I haven't tried any treatments or used any new skin products for these lesions.
Final Diagnosis: Vitiligo.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient reports having painless, light-colored patches on their upper arms and left side of the trunk, which have been present for approximately 5 months. The patient notes that these patches have remained constant in size and shape since first being noticed. The patches are reported to be asymptomatic, causing neither itch nor sensation. The patient denies any personal or family history of skin diseases, and states they are otherwise healthy without any chronic illnesses. Additionally, the patient has not attempted any treatments nor used new skin products for these lesions.
